narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to write a HUGE research paper
Learned a lot about my topic and essay writing.
How to research in primary and secondary sources for a senior art history essay.
I wrote about a topic I loved! :)

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I loved the structure, it was the perfect balance of giving freedom for us to learn how to execute the process on our own, while also giving us achievable benchmarks.
I think it was structured well! All the deadlines helped.

I appreciated how structured the writing process was, but I think this course could be improved by allowing students to determine the structure for themselves. For instance, I found some of the internal assignments (ex. the annotated bibliography) as very extraneous and 'busy work'; devoting time to them felt like the opposite of helpful. Instead, I think it would be good to let students set their semester-long schedules for themselves, perhaps in the form of a calendar they turn into the DUS/their advisors at the start of the semester (alongside the initial project statement).
I really enjoyed the community aspect of this course the most with our colloquiums and investment in peers' projects.

The major strength of the Senior Essay is its self-directed nature -- you have a lot of freedom to decide which topic to pursue and how to approach it. My main recommendation is that it would be helpful for the HSAR department to provide more formal support in connecting students with advisors. While finding an advisor is a necessary part of the process, it can sometimes be excessively difficult (in my opinion). For students struggling to identify a thesis advisor, the HSAR department could provide one-on-one consultations to brainstorm potential advisors and back-up plans. The department could also host events where students in the major get to know faculty members who are open to advising. This would help students gauge their personality fit with potential advisors and get to know faculty members they may not have taken classes with.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: YES do it. SO FUN but SUCH a challenge, but so worth it
it was hard but you have to :-( but hopefully you'll write on something that you enjoy! :-)
If you're an art history major of course because you have to write a senior essay.

The Senior Essay is an exciting opportunity to explore a topic that deeply interests you -- I would highly recommend choosing something that you find fun or meaningful, regardless of whether it falls within the formal category of "art history"
